Class Character

java.lang.Object
characters.Character
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClanChief, FantasyCreature, FoodServiceTest_2.TestCharacter, Gaul, Roman
public abstract class Character extends Object
Represents a generic character in the game world. This abstract class defines all shared attributes and the abstract actions common to any living entity capable of fighting, eating, healing, drinking magic potion, and potentially dying.

  • Constructor Details

    • Character

      public Character(String name, Gender gender, int height, int age, int strength, int endurance, int health, int hunger, int belligerence, int magicPotionLevel, PersonType personType)
      Creates a new character with all base attributes.
      Parameters:
      name - character's name
      gender - biological gender
      height - height in centimeters
      age - age in years
      strength - physical strength
      endurance - resistance to damage
      health - current health points
      hunger - current hunger level
      belligerence - belligerence level
      magicPotionLevel - current magic potion quantity

  • Method Details

    • heal

      public void heal(int points)
      Heals this character by a given amount. Takes the smaller value between the health healed and the maxHealth.
      Parameters:
      points - amount of healing points to add

    • eat

      public void eat(int points)
      Feeds this character and reduces hunger.
      Parameters:
      points - amount of hunger reduction

    • drinkPotion

      public void drinkPotion(Pot pot)
      Drinks a dose of magic potion. If the character drinks 1 pot of potion the effects are permanents If the Character drinks 2 pots of potion it kills him

    • fight

      public void fight(Character character)
      Allows the character to fight another one

    • receiveDamage

      public void receiveDamage(int points)
      Handles the damage system to correctly kill the character.
      Parameters:
      points -

    • die

      public void die()
      Makes this character die. Implementations should update internal state to reflect death.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this character. The output contains all attributes with their current values.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
